metadata.synopsis: Path in epilogue when players have one last moment with their romance partner.Wyll could be1. The Blade of Frontiers2, The Blade of Avernus3. Grand DukeIn all three cases, he may or may not be pacted, and he may or may not look like a devil.

174.speaker: Wyll
174.text: My shining star. Since I've known you, we've shed more blood than could ever fill the Chionthar. The wounds we sustained were the testament to our might.

235.speaker: Wyll
235.text: But last night, I swear to you - your touch healed every one of my bruises and wiped away every scar.

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *A moment passes. Wylls eyes glance up to his horns.*
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: A moment passes. Wylls eyes glance upwards.

169.speaker: Wyll
169.text: - and in more ways than one.

150.speaker: Wyll
150.text: When Mizora drained my warlock powers, it was if a blizzard froze me through.

119.speaker: Wyll
119.text: Then you reignited my fires. When I'm at your side, I want for nothing.

226.speaker: Wyll
226.text: *Sigh* If only last night could have lasted forever. But if I'm to be a Grand Duke, I've got to greet the people and gain their trust.

95.speaker: Wyll
95.text: First, we mourn. We bow our heads for the fallen, and honour them by pledging peace.

263.speaker: Wyll
263.text: Next, we heal the city. We restore our broken buildings, stone by stone. We restore faith in each other, one good turn at a time.

240.speaker: Wyll
240.text: After that, well - it's up to us to decide. Any ideas?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: A grand wedding is in order. I want to show off my groom to the city.

195.speaker: Wyll
195.text: And a magnificent ball, I presume, for dancing the night away. You dressed to the nines, me in the finest uniform I can convince father to lend me.

77.speaker: Wyll
77.text: And a magnificent ball, I presume, for dancing the night away. You wear your finest, and I'll look for one of father's dress uniforms.

218.speaker: Wyll
218.text: How could I ever refuse you?

153.speaker: Player
153.text: I'd like to start a family.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: Ha! You've already thought about a little Ravengard running around, have you?

274.speaker: Wyll
274.text: I'd like that. So would father, I bet. A nipper to bear his name, learn the pillars. Courage, insight, strategy, justice.

186.speaker: Wyll
186.text: I'd like that. Someone to carry our name, learn the four pillars. If only father -

261.speaker: Wyll
261.text: Well. Father would have loved having a grandchild. I know we'll raise a family worthy of his name.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Open the gates and welcome every last refugee who seeks sanctuary.

223.speaker: Wyll
223.text: My star. The parasites have barely withered, your heart still hurts for them.

260.speaker: Wyll
260.text: Let it be done. The Jewel of the Coast will shine ever bright, welcoming the weak and the weary, from wherever they hail.

157.speaker: Wyll
157.text: If father were here... he'd be so proud of you. Proud of us.

37.speaker: Wyll
37.text: What a joy, this life we're about to make, this story we're about to write - every chapter more thrilling than the last.

252.speaker: Narrator
252.text: *You detect the slightest hint of sorrow behind Wyll's words. His diabolical patron and the torturous fate that awaits him are never far from his mind.*

85.speaker: Wyll
85.text: I hope we never have to turn to the final page.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Declare your authority. March the Flaming Fist through the streets.

249.speaker: Wyll
249.text: And why not name myself Archduke while I'm at it, maybe build some steel automatons to watch over the gates?

42.speaker: Wyll
42.text: I'm not Gortash. I don't want to instil fear, I want to instil hope. Hope for a bountiful future, hope for a life free of tyranny and torment -

275.speaker: Wyll
275.text: - hope for leaders that won't turn their backs to suffering.

116.speaker: Wyll
116.text: It's the least we can give them: a future worth looking forward to.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: An old-fashioned monster hunt, just the two of us.

66.speaker: Wyll
66.text: There they are - the great champion of Baldur's Gate. I'll gather the snares, you can fletch the arrows.

189.speaker: Wyll
189.text: A duke I'm soon to be - but the Blade's heart is never far from the frontiers.

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: *Sigh* If only last night could have lasted forever. How are you feeling, my darling?

276.speaker: Player
276.text: Not good. I don't have long now.

75.speaker: Wyll
75.text: Karlach... is there really no other way? Now that you've reached the end of the line, do you still refuse to return to Avernus? To live?

49.speaker: Wyll
49.text: Raphael's set his sights on Zariel's throne. She'll be too busy fighting him to pursue you.

59.speaker: Wyll
59.text: I can't. I'm responsible for Baldur's Gate. She needs me - desperately, now more than ever. I can't abandon her.

4.speaker: Wyll
4.text: But I can't abandon you either. Return to Avernus - for now - and I'll join you once the city's been put to rights after this disaster.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: All right, Wyll. All right. I'll go.

279.speaker: Wyll
279.text: Then this is goodbye. For now. Until we meet again, my love - I'll think of you every day. Now go. Live. You deserve that much.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: No. I won't go back. I can't. Anything but that.

244.speaker: Player
244.text: I'd rather die in my home than live - barely - in the place I hate. All I want is to see the sky one last time.

170.speaker: Wyll
170.text: Oh, my love. I wish I could understand. But I respect your wishes. If this is your time, I will stand by your side.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: Maybe you're right. Maybe I should go back.

100.speaker: Wyll
100.text: You won't be alone. I need to set Baldur's Gate to rights after this disaster, but once she's stable, I could join you. Hunt out devils - real devils - together.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I'm fine. Let's talk about the future.

175.speaker: Wyll
175.text: What future, Karlach? A future without you in it is no future at all. Is there really no other way?

239.speaker: Wyll
239.text: Now that you've reached the end of the line, do you still refuse to return to Avernus? To live?

140.speaker: Player
140.text: Try to contain the inferno threatening to consume you.

202.speaker: Wyll
202.text: I see it in your eyes. The time is near.

117.speaker: Narrator
117.text: *A moment passes. The corners of Wyll's mouth turn downwards before he smiles again.*
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: A moment passes. The corners of Wyll's mouth turn downwards before he smiles again.

166.speaker: Wyll
166.text: - and I've got you to thank for it.

184.speaker: Wyll
184.text: Through you, I've been born anew.

92.speaker: Wyll
92.text: There's something I need to ask you. Something terrible, something greedy, something unreasonable.

138.speaker: Wyll
138.text: I'm the Blade of Avernus. I swore to cleanse the Hells of the devils that threaten the Coast. And I know my first target:

208.speaker: Wyll
208.text: I won't let her claim one more soul, slay one more victim. I'm going to make my way to the Hells and tear the horns right off her damned head.

132.speaker: Wyll
132.text: I want you to join me. A reasonable person would say 'no'. I still want you to say 'yes'.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I couldn't be more ready. Let's descend to the Hells and kill Mizora.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: A revenge quest? You're better than this, Wyll.

121.speaker: Wyll
121.text: It's not about me. It's about every desperate soul Mizora will recruit to the Blood War, every life she snuffs out on Zariel's whims.

9.speaker: Wyll
9.text: I want you to see my blade slice her wings off her back, to hear her groans as she dissolves into ash.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Are you sure you're ready? Mizora drained you of your powers.

141.speaker: Wyll
141.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. The four pillars of power. Not an eldritch blast to be found.

207.speaker: Wyll
207.text: Father trained me in the sword and the bow. They'll have to sustain me.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Please let her go. For me, for us, for the good of Faerûn.

64.speaker: Wyll
64.text: *Sigh.* I must have played this conversation in my head a dozen times this tenday, and practised how I'd say 'no'.

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: But I can't. Not when I know deep down that you're right.

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: Forget Mizora. The people of the Coast call to the Blade and his star. Are you ready to be their hero?

7.speaker: Player
7.text: This is where we part ways, Wyll.

144.speaker: Wyll
144.text: I - I don't know what to say. I was sure we'd be carving out a future together.

56.speaker: Wyll
56.text: Perhaps one day you'll change your mind - but if you won't, at least know this:

209.speaker: Wyll
209.text: Wherever you go, you take my heart with you. So strong is my love that not even a devil could break it.

278.speaker: Wyll
278.text: I'm sorry. The next we meet, my blade will stained with Mizora's blood.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Let's do it, then. I'll join you in the Hells and help kill Mizora.

80.speaker: Wyll
80.text: All these years as the Blade - I've been called a champion. A hero. A legend. Names I never asked for, praise I never sought.

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: But you? You've earned the right to be called 'hero' a thousand times over. What a gift you've been to the Sword Coast.

118.speaker: Wyll
118.text: And what a gift you've been to me. What an honour to walk alongside a true legend.

268.speaker: Wyll
268.text: Come. The next page in our saga begins.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Let's do it, then. I'll join you in the Hells and help kill Mizora.

267.speaker: Wyll
267.text: So be it. The next we meet, my blade will stained with Mizora's blood.

58.speaker: Wyll
58.text: All I can ask then is - wait for me. If you can't, if you won't, then know this:

176.speaker: Player
176.text: I can't. I just can't, Wyll. All I want is to see the sky one last time.

33.speaker: Wyll
33.text: I can't force you, Karlach. And if you'd rather go now - here - I suppose I have no choice but to respect it, though it breaks my heart in two.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: No, it's too dangerous. Zariel's forces would crush us.

205.speaker: Wyll
205.text: Then we die proud, knowing we braved the Hells to slay the fiend who held my leash.

134.speaker: Wyll
134.text: But I have faith in me, in us. We'll cut Mizora to ribbons before she can so much as groan Zariel's name.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: And what of Mizora's warlocks? We'd be disrupting their lives.

200.speaker: Wyll
200.text: So be it. They'd lose nothing but power they hadn't yet gained. I'm not worried for them.

227.speaker: Wyll
227.text: I'm worried for every desperate soul Mizora will recruit to the Blood War, every life she snuffs out on Zariel's whims.

281.speaker: Wyll
281.text: I want you to join me. I want you to live, Karlach. We can have a life together, even in Avernus. A real life.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I couldn't be more ready. Let's descend to the Hells and kill Mizora.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: You know I can't go back. Zariel would crush me without a thought. I'd rather die here, at home, than in the Hells.

229.speaker: Wyll
229.text: If we're meant to die, then let's do it together. Doing something worth dying for - hunting devils.

216.speaker: Wyll
216.text: Don't throw your life away, Karlach. Not like this.

255.speaker: Wyll
255.text: I am the Blade of Frontiers. I swore to protect the Coast from the monsters that prey on it. And I know my first target:

62.speaker: Wyll
62.text: You've made me a new man.

266.speaker: Wyll
266.text: I'm the Blade of Avernus. I swore to cleanse the Hells of the devils that threaten the Coast.

180.speaker: Wyll
180.text: I am the Blade of Frontiers. I swore to protect the Coast from the monsters that prey on it.

86.speaker: Wyll
86.text: I want you to join me. Warriors, lovers, guardians. Two champions as one.

50.speaker: Wyll
50.text: A reasonable person would say 'no'. I still want you to say 'yes'.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Are you sure you're ready? Mizora drained you of your powers.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Of course I'll join you. I thought you'd never ask!

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *You detect the slightest hint of sorrow behind Wyll's words. The hellish fate that awaits him is never far from his mind.*

173.speaker: Player
173.text: Of course I'll join you. I thought you'd never ask!

149.speaker: Player
149.text: These are your battles to fight, not mine. But I'll always be here for you when you return.

137.speaker: Wyll
137.text: Heh - I was selfish to ask. And even more selfish, to be disappointed by your answer.

1.speaker: Wyll
1.text: And what a gift you've been to me, to keep our flame burning even when the winds of change threaten to blow it out.

151.speaker: Wyll
151.text: Come, rest with me tonight. And next I see you, may that flame be raging even stronger.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: I can't, Wyll, not while Mizora pulls the strings.

128.speaker: Wyll
128.text: The eternal burden of my pact. I certainly couldn't expect you to shoulder it too.

171.speaker: Wyll
171.text: I want you to join me. I want you to live, Karlach. We can have a life together, even in Avernus. A real life.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: If you're by my side, I can do it. All right Wyll. We'll return to Avernus.

168.speaker: Wyll
168.text: That is... how are you feeling, darling? You look... peaked.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: Not good. I don't have long now.

220.speaker: Wyll
220.text: Karlach... is there really no other way? Now that you've reached the end of the line, do you still refuse to return to Avernus? To live?

19.speaker: Wyll
19.text: Raphael's set his sights on Zariel's throne. She'll be too busy fighting him to pursue you.

194.speaker: Wyll
194.text: Anything for you, my love. Together, we'll cut the Hells in two. And Zariel will never lay a hand on you - I swear it.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: All right, Wyll. All right. I'll go.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: I can't, Wyll. I can't go back. I'd rather die here, in my home, than go back there. All I want is to see the sky one last time.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I'd rather die in my home than live - barely - in the place I hate.

73.speaker: Wyll
73.text: Oh, my love. I wish I could understand. But I respect your wishes. If this is your time, I will stand by your side.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Maybe you're right. Maybe I should go back.

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: You won't be alone. I need to set Baldur's Gate to rights after this disaster, but once she's stable, I could join you. Hunt out devils - real devils - together.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: I'm fine. Let's talk about the future.

143.speaker: Wyll
143.text: What future, Karlach? A future without you in it is no future at all. Is there really no other way?

264.speaker: Wyll
264.text: Now that you've reached the end of the line, do you still refuse to return to Avernus? To live?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Try to contain the inferno threatening to consume you.

18.speaker: Wyll
18.text: I see it in your eyes. The time is near.

271.speaker: Wyll
271.text: I'd parade you through the streets if I could. 'The illithid who saved Baldur's Gate', the bards would cry - and you would take your rightful place at the side of Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard.

71.speaker: Wyll
71.text: A beautiful fantasy. If only I could wish it into being.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: The people of Baldur's Gate will accept a devil as a duke - but they'd never accept his mind flayer consort.

10.speaker: Wyll
10.text: They would never see you as the hero I know you to be. They would only see a mind flayer.

193.speaker: Wyll
193.text: I love you. But I can't be with you. Not the way I wanted.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You promised yourself to me for an eternity...

241.speaker: Wyll
241.text: I meant it. And I still do.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: So that's it? You'd just throw me away after the sacrifice that I made?

27.speaker: Wyll
27.text: We'll make a place for you in the undercity, a secluded corner of your own. I'll bring you anything you need - robes, books... sustenance. You'll be safe.
27.context: NodeContext: Sustenance = brains, so a bit of hesitation there

210.speaker: Wyll
210.text: I'll visit as often as I can. We can still dance, we can still write a story, we can still be us.

91.speaker: Wyll
91.text: This doesn't have to be the end.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'd like that. Let's do it.

163.speaker: Wyll
163.text: Gods, you're so wonderful, my heart's near to bursting.

147.speaker: Wyll
147.text: What a gift you've been to me. What an honour to know a true legend.

28.speaker: Wyll
28.text: It pains me to know you must live this half-life, hidden in shadows when you deserve to bask in the Sword Coast's sun.

233.speaker: Wyll
233.text: But it warms me to know you'll be near.

190.speaker: Narrator
190.text: *Your mind turns to the future. Does happiness lurk in the bowels of the city? Does it lurk anywhere at all for one stuck in the skin of a monster?*

242.speaker: Narrator
242.text: *But in one thought, you find comfort: you don't have to face tomorrow alone.*

237.speaker: Player
237.text: It's not what I wanted, but I'm willing to give it a try.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: I won't go back to the Undercity. Not after I know all the horrors I wrought there as the Temple's leader.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I think it's better if I'm on my own.

206.speaker: Wyll
206.text: I was selfish to ask you to live a half-life as an underground plaything for a duke. And even more selfish, to be disappointed by your answer.

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: An uneasy life awaits you. But know this:

247.speaker: Wyll
247.text: Wherever you go, you take my heart with you. So strong is my love that not even a devil could break it.

182.speaker: Narrator
182.text: *Your mind turns to the future. Where will you go, and how will you feed? Can you ever find stability stuck in the skin of a monster?*

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *Yet of one thing, you are most certain: whatever comes next, you'll face it alone.*

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Sod off. I don't want to be your dirty little secret.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I cured the Urge. I want a free future, even if I look like this.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: For the first time, I have a future. I want to share it with you.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I understand. Your duty is to the city.

68.speaker: Wyll
68.text: It is. But that doesn't mean I have to discard you like a rotted carcass.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: Please, Wyll - we can make this work.

280.speaker: Wyll
280.text: Of course we can. And I know just how to do it.

270.speaker: Wyll
270.text: I'd venture into the wilds with you at my side, if I could. 'The illithid who saved Baldur's Gate', I would cry, and the people would greet you as the hero I know you to be.

130.speaker: Wyll
130.text: A beautiful fantasy. If only I could wish it into being.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: The people I'm sworn to protect will see only an illithid. They would cower in fear - or worse yet, try to fill you with arrows and daggers.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: You promised yourself to me for an eternity...

262.speaker: Player
262.text: So that's it? You'd just throw me away after the sacrifice that I made?

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I cured the Urge. I want a free future, even if I look like this.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: For the first time, I have a future. I want to share it with you.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I understand. Your duty is to the Sword Coast.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: Please, Wyll - we can make this work.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: We'll make a place for you - somewhere secluded, somewhere you can call home.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: I'll bring you anything you need - robes, books... sustenance. You'll be safe.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I'd like that. Let's do it.

120.speaker: Wyll
120.text: But it warms me to I can always find you, dance with you, in the years to come.

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *Your mind turns to the future. Does happiness lurk in the remote corners of the Coast? Does it lurk anywhere at all for one stuck in the skin of a monster?*

178.speaker: Player
178.text: It's not what I wanted, but I'm willing to give it a try.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I won't go back to the Undercity. Not after I know all the horrors I wrought there as the Temple's leader.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I think it's better if I'm on my own.

38.speaker: Wyll
38.text: I was selfish to ask you to live a half-life as a plaything for the Blade of Avernus. And even more selfish, to be disappointed by your answer.

185.speaker: Wyll
185.text: I was selfish to ask you to live a half-life as a plaything for the Blade of Frontiers. And even more selfish, to be disappointed by your answer.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Sod off. I don't want to be your dirty little secret.
